column3: The test failure might be fixed after #11433

> - The boost package installed via pkg_add now seems to work correctly. So we shouldn't require manual building + patching.\n\n**[gcc]** I can confirm this. Good to know! Have run the `make check` successfully, as well as `test/functional/test_runner.py` as well as synced a testnet node part of the way w/ their boost package. This does go from boost 1.64 to 1.58, but I don't think that's so bad
@laanwj Thanks for testing. I've fixed the GCC header, as well as a link to build-unix.md

@fanquake Thanks!

**[clang]** Tests also passed:
```
ALL                            | âœ“ Passed  | 1708 s (accumulated) 
Runtime: 574 s
```

Edit: travis issue is the whitespace watchdog
```
diff --git a/doc/build-openbsd.md b/doc/build-openbsd.md
@@ -29,39 +29,4 @@ The default C++ compiler that comes with OpenBSD 5.9 is g++ 4.2. This version is
+
^---- failure generated
Fixed the whitespace, and one other typo.
Looks merge-ready to me now, feel free to remove WIP tag (all three points have been addressed in above discussion).
I think we should keep this around just in case people run against these limits, as it's likely very close even if you didn't need it.

Not sure why you're removing the explicit description for GCC here - it's intentional that there is a "GCC" and "Clang" header, with the instructions above shared between both.\nWhen using clang it's not necessary to install g++ (better not to, probably).

I think this is also still true?
```
OpenBSD 6.1 (GENERIC.MP) #20: Sat Apr  1 13:45:56 MDT 2017
...
user@cocytus user$ g++ --version
g++ (GCC) 4.2.1 20070719 
```
